ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Overall, I loved this class because it was engaging, had a well-chosen reading syllabus, and didn't claim to be a complete overview of its content material. I welcome that Directed Studies continues to be an ever-evolving program that refuses to leave behind the classics but also increasingly places these works in their historical context and modern context. Professor Nakhimovsky an excellent instructor that has a deep commitment to historical inquiry. He pushes his class to recognize the forces behind the works we studied and to really analyze our understanding of a work. Definitely recommend this section of DS.
It is a great survey of some of the major works in political thought since Luther. Even if it is not comprehensive, it covers a good range and I highly recommend it.
An excellent course -- definitely worth taking if you want to have a basic understanding of modern historical thought.
Would recommend; group exercises aren't always that productive
